CheckTitle: Ensure Priority Account Protection is Enabled
Description: Checks if Priority Account Protection is enabled in Email Tenant Settings.
Risk: If Priority Account Protection is not enabled, high-value accounts may be more vulnerable to targeted attacks.

Code.Other: 1. Go to Microsoft 365 Defender (https://security.microsoft.com). 2. Expand Email & collaboration > Policies & rules > Threat policies. 3. Under Settings, enable Priority Account Protection.

Recommendation.Text: Enable Priority Account Protection in Email Tenant Settings for enhanced security of high-value accounts.

Notes: This check validates that Priority Account Protection is enabled in Email Tenant Settings.
